means: （陆军的）一营（大约有一千兵士）

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: from French bataillon, from Italian battaglione, from battaglia 'battle', from Latin (see battle)

entry.def: A battalion is a large group of soldiers that consists of three or more companies.

example.ex: Anthony was ordered to return to his battalion...
example.tran: 安东尼受命返回自己的军营。

example.ex: He joined the second battalion of the Grenadier Guards.
example.tran: 他加入了英国近卫步兵第一团第二营。

entry.tran: （尤指有组织、有特定任务、高效的）一大群，一大批
entry.def: A battalion of people is a large group of them, especially a well-organized, efficient group that has a particular task to do.

example.ex: There were battalions of highly paid publicists to see that such news didn't make the press.
example.tran: 有一大批拿高薪的公关人员可以确保这样的新闻不会见诸报端。

means.word_mean: 1. an army unit usually consisting of a headquarters and three or more companies

stems_affixes.word_buile: bat打,击+on表名词→n.指挥棒,警棍
bat打,击+alion表名词→battalion→打的[队伍]→部队的营
bat打,击+tle表动词→n.战役,战斗;斗争 v.战斗,斗争,搏斗
re回+bat打,击+e→打回去的[东西]→回扣
de加强+bat打,击+e→加强打击→反驳,辩论
a不+bat打,击+e→不再打击→减轻[痛苦]等
bat打,击+tle表动词→n.战役,战斗;斗争 v.战斗,斗争,搏斗

sentences.en: The government began to recruit new battalions.
sentences.cn: 政府开始征集新的部队。
